meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the organismic behavior of the ants in the colony.
meanings.sent2: The ecosystem relies on the organismic interactions between plants and animals.
meanings.sent3: The organismic dance of the bees was quite entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: The city pulsated with an organismic energy, like a living, breathing entity.
meanings.sent5: The organismic growth of the plants in the garden was a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Involving or pertaining to the organization of living things.
meanings.sent1: The biologist conducted research on the organismic structure of cells.
meanings.sent2: The organismic hierarchy within the animal kingdom is fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The organismic arrangement of the flowers in the garden seemed almost intentional.
meanings.sent4: The company functioned like a well-oiled machine, with an organismic flow of communication.
meanings.sent5: The organismic development of the embryo was a marvel of nature.
